title: Direction
text: We can tell whether the parabola goes up or down based on the sign of a in the equation, $$y=a x^2+b x+c$$. If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.
speech: We can tell whether the parabola goes up or down based on the sign of a in the equation,  y is equal to a x squared, plus b x plus c . If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.

. If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.

title: Direction
text: Since our a is negative, what does this tell us about our parabola?

title: Downwards Direction
text: Since our a is negative, we know that our parabola will open up downwards.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: To find the vertex, we need to find the axis is symmetry, which is found using the formula, $$x=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry

title: Finding the Vertex

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Since our $$x$$ is $$2$$, we plug it into our equation as, $$y=-\left(2^2\right)+4\times2-3$$. This gives us $$y=1$$.

title: Finding the x-intercepts
text: We must factor the GCF from our equation and factor the trinomial. After this, we solve for $$x$$, which are $$1$$ and $$3$$ in this case, so the x-intercepts are $$(1,0)$$ and $$(3,0)$$.
